greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of tree-rooted planar maps with n edges and k+1 faces, n >= 0, k = 0..n.
comment: The number of vertices is n + 1 - k.
A tree-rooted planar map is a planar map with a distinguished spanning tree.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1325 (rows 0..50)
R. C. Mullin, On the Enumeration of Tree-Rooted Maps, Canadian Journal of Mathematics, Volume 19, 1967, pp. 174-183.
mathematica: Table[(2 n)!/(k!*(k + 1)!*(n - k)!*(n - k + 1)!), {n, 0, 8}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 06 2021 *)
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Apr 03 2021
